TopicTitle: Can a Hitch Hiker container Dock with a Senior sized docking port?

Articles.Content:
The HitchHiker container has the appearance of a docking port. Can it dock directly to a Clamp-o-tron Senior docking port? or other size? or is the top and bottom hatch just for show?

Also, how do I mark this question as "Answered" (after I get my answer)?

Edited March 13, 2014 by JedTech
Question Answered!

Hitchhikers do not have docking ports, and cannot interact with docking ports on their own. The hatches on the top/bottom are just for show.

I have no idea how to mark it answered. This is the first question I've answered!

Lolbster is correct; the Hitchhiker's surface details are mostly just for looks, and it does not have a built-in docking capability. To change the status of a thread, the OP must edit the first post in the thread, then choose the "go advanced" options, and choose "answered" from the little menu there.

you can, of course, attach a sr docking port on to the top of one - I have one with a sr on the top and bottom and use it as a payload for one of my multi-purpose landers so I can bring crew down to the surface of the moons or bring them back in to orbit.

The HitchHiker container has the appearance of a docking port. Can it dock directly to a Clamp-o-tron Senior docking port? or other size? or is the top and bottom hatch just for show?

Not only does it have the Apperance of a docking port, but in the wiki it's categorized in "Parts.Docking" http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Parts#Docking

Which lead me to this thread also to get my answer.

Is the wiki wrong?
